resources.string: Use the green button to select a Trial
No Trials Available.\nUse Import to load some
No Traits Available.\nUse Import to load some
No Tags Available.\nUse Import to load some
Names the device operator for KDXchange
Use a white background when scoring for improved visibility outside
Prevent accidental value change for scored Traits
Start in left-hand mode when scoring Traits
Import Trial: Select CSV or KDX File
KDX Trial Export: Select Output Folder
KDX Trait Export: Select Output Folder
KDX Tag Export: Select Output Folder
Next Sample is not in adjacent Plot
Previous Sample is not in adjacent Plot
Check to confirm Location, Un-check for a brief message
Check to use Location for scoring
Auto Advance is ON\nTouch again to turn it OFF
Auto Advance is OFF\nTouch again to turn it ON
You may wish to run a Trial Scores Validation check
Cant change datatype, Trait was scored before

The Tag selected for deletion is shown along with any Trials where it is currently used.

KDSmart will indicate if the Tag is unable to be deleted.

If the Tag is not used in any Trials it can be deleted by selecting the Delete button.

Otherwise select the cancel ✘ button or the Android back button to return to the previous window.

The Trait selected for deletion is shown along with any Trials where it is currently used.

KDSmart will indicate if the Trait is unable to be deleted.

When a Trait is unused by any Trial it can be deleted by selecting the Delete button.

Otherwise select the cancel ✘ button or the Android back button to return to the previous window.

Enter a Bundle Name for the new Tag Bundle.

Listed beneath All Bundles are the names of any existing Tag Bundles.

Select an existing Tag Bundle Name to either:

◉ Add the displayed Tag(s) to the selected Bundle; or
◉ Partially autofill the Bundle Name which may help to ensure naming consistency and reduce typing.

Save changes using the Create/Add button which will then return to the Tags window with the Tag Bundle selected.

Enter a Bundle Name for the new Trait Bundle.

Listed beneath All Bundles are names of any existing Trait Bundles.

An existing Trait Bundle Name can be selected to either:
◉ Add the displayed Trait(s) to the selected Bundle; or
◉ Partially autofill the Bundle Name which may help to ensure naming consistency and reduce typing.

Save changes using the Create/Add button which will then return to the Traits window with the Trait Bundle selected.

The Traits selected for removal from the Trait Bundle are displayed for confirmation.

To proceed with removal of these displayed Traits from this Trait Bundle select the Delete button.

Otherwise select the cancel ✘ button or the Android back button to return to the previous window.

Note: Removing an instance of a Trait from a Trait Bundle does not delete the Trait.

The Tags selected for removal from the Tag Bundle are displayed for confirmation.

To proceed with removal of these displayed Tags from this Tag Bundle select the Delete button.

Otherwise select the cancel ✘ button or the Android back button to return to the previous window.

Note: Removing an instance of a Tag from a Tag Bundle does not delete the Tag.

The Tag Bundle selected for deletion is shown along with the Tag Instances it contains.

To proceed with removal of the displayed Tag Bundle select the Delete button.

Otherwise select the cancel ✘ button or the Android back button to return to the previous window.

Note: Deleting a Tag Bundle does not delete Tag(s), contained within the Tag Bundle from KDSmart.

The Trait Bundle selected for deletion is displayed along with the Traits it contains.

To proceed with removal of the displayed Trait Bundle select the Delete button.

Otherwise select the cancel ✘ button or the Android back button to return to the previous window.

Note: Deleting a Trait Bundle does not delete Trait(s), contained within the Trait Bundle from KDSmart.
Within a Trial this option determines what plot identification information will be displayed when scoring.

The Manage Trials window displays the Trials that are currently loaded into KDSmart.

Warning: Demonstration Mode should NOT be used for your real, live Trials/Experiments.
It is ONLY intended for demonstration, training and trying KDSmart purposes. All data in Demonstration mode can be lost with any version upgrades and will be lost when choosing to Reset Demo Data which restores the demonstration example Trials.
Demonstration Mode is indicated by DEMO DB appearing on the KDSmart main screen.

To display details for a Trial, Touch the Trial Name. The top left logo or back button will return to the Manage Trial display.

The selected/highlighted Trial has the following actions are available from the Action Bar and menu:

◉ Score ( ► ) opens the Scoring Configuration for the Trial, a first step for scoring to commence.
◉ Export To copies the Trial to either a CSV file or KDXplore. For more information on exporting Trials refer to the KDSmart User Guide.
◉ Delete removes the Trial from KDSmart. (Please take the usual cautions when deleting.)
◉ Sort - Sorts the list of Trials.

If in Demonstration mode, the Random Demo Data option will appear on the menu.
This is only for Demonstration Data Base purposes - to provide some random data for the selected Trial with these options:
  ◎ Score Samples - Generates sample data with probability of Sample being scored ranging from 10% to 100%;
  ◎ Add Attachments - Generates attachments and Tags; and
  ◎ Clear All Data - Clears all sample data for the selected Demo Trial - Confirmation required.

Other actions that can be performed are:
◉ Add Trial - Manual entry of a Trial;
◉ Import From to load a Trial from:
  ◎ A CSV data file;
  ◎ The KDXplore desktop program; or
  ◎ A KDDart database server.
◉ A Long Press of a Trial enables Multiple Trial selection.

Remember, to commence scoring a Trial, touch the Score action to open the Scoring Configuration dialog.

The two choices for scoring are Spread Sheet View and Path View.
It is possible to change the scoring view to suit your current circumstances.
Note: For either view, the underlying functionality for recording Traits is the same.

Spread Sheet View provides a tabular, view of a Trial/Nursery in a spread sheet style format.
Path View requires a choice of the order in which you wish to visit the Plots (i.e. Cells), how many cells to collect from as a group and some other options. These are in the main Options panel.

You may also select which Trait Instances are to be used in the current scoring session. Swipe left or right, or touch the desired Tab name to see the relevant panel.

Collection Path
When in Path View the Collection Path needs to be selected by choosing:
1. Which corner of Field to start; and
2. What direction of travel to use; and
3. Whether or not to use a Serpentine collection path.

Trait Instances
A Trial/Nursery may have many Traits associated, however all Traits do not need to be visible or scored during every scoring session. Trait Instances may be hidden or visible (i.e. the stars next to each Trait Instance) to suit your needs at the time.
This will assist in decluttering the scoring screen for both Path and Spread Sheet view.

Traits with multiple instances are grouped by the Trait Name and have an instance number. Touch the Trait Name to show the members; a long-press will turn on/off all of the Trait\'s individual stars.

The filled-in star (★) indicates that Trait Instance will be included in the scoring session and the hollow star (☆) indicates it will hidden from scoring. A filled-in star on a Trait Name indicates that all of the instances in that group will be scored.

A half-filled star indicates that only some of the members are selected for scoring.

Select All and Select None using the "Title" row at the top of the panel is also available.

Choose Tag Bundle displays the available Tag Bundles which can be made available to the Trial when scoring.
Where many Tags may exist, a smaller subset of Tags can be presented for the scoring session by using Tag Bundles.

The Lock Scored Traits option assists to avoid accidental changes to values when working in the field to an already scored Trait.
Pressing an already scored Trait will show a cautionary display, to either cancel or edit the Trait.

The Improved Outside visibility option toggles the display to use a white background when scoring outdoors.

Actions available within Manage Traits include:

◉ ✎ Edit,
◉ ➕Add;
◉ Import From;
◉ Export To;
◉ Delete;
◉ Italics for Protected;
◉ Numeric Keypad Text Size;
◉ Scanner On;
◉ Sort; and
◉ Help.

A Long Press (on a Trait) enters Selection mode with these menu opions:

◉ Select All;
◉ Export To;
◉ Add/Create Trait Bundle; and
◉ Delete (Trait or Remove from Bundle).

Use the ✎ action to Edit or the ➕ action to Add a new Trait and the Import From and Export To actions to move Traits in and out of KDSmart

Touch a Trait Name to view the Trait details. While viewing Trait Details use the Edit (✎) and Add (➕) actions as required.

A custom Alias can be entered to reduce the required screen space when Scoring. This may be useful when the Trait Name cannot be edited due to Organisational policy and long names have been provided.

Trait Bundles enable the grouping of Traits which can assist with their use and management. The All Traits Bundle is permanent and cannot be removed.

In the Manage Traits screen, Trait Bundles appear amongst the Traits with the number of Traits in the bundle appearing to the right of the Bundle name. The contents of the Bundles can be expanded ˆ or collapsed ˇ by touching the Bundle Name row.

Add Traits to a Bundle within Manage Traits by a long press of a Trait which will select the Trait and change the menu options. In this mode additional Traits can be selected by a short press of each Trait. With selection complete, select the Add Trait Bundle button to display the Add Trait Bundle window.

To remove a Trait from a Bundle, in Manage Traits locate the Trait within the appropriate Bundle. Long press the Trait name and short press any additional Traits, then select the Remove/Delete button. At the popup menu select Remove from Bundle and confirm.

A Bundle can be deleted in Manage Traits by a long press of the Bundle name, then select the Delete button and confirm.

Note: Traits can exist in multiple Bundles and removing a Trait from a Bundle will only remove the Trait from the Bundle and does not delete the Trait.

When viewing Trial Details some of the Trial attributes can be edited.

Trials may have many Traits, however it is not necessary or desirable for them all to be visible when scoring. Traits can be made visible or hidden when required.

The blue highlighted panel, near the bottom of the Trail Details display:
◉ Lists the Trait Instances available in the Trial;
◉ Indicates how many instances are for each Trait; and
◉ Shows those currently selected (★) for Scoring or not selected (☆) i.e. hidden.

For convenience the Scoring Configuration dialog is displayed when the ► action is chosen for the Trial. At this stage the Traits can easily be made visible or hidden for the scoring session.

Use the ✎ button to change the selected Trait Instances.

Long press any Trial to enter Selection mode to select one or more Trials:
◉ For Export; or
◉ To Delete.

Use the Export To action to export a single Trial.

Use the Delete action to remove selected Trials from the database.

Cancel using the "tick" in the left of the Action Bar.

Exercise caution when deleting Trials. As a precaution ensure any Trial export was successful by first viewing and checking the Trial CSV contents or viewing Trial data in KDXplore before deleting from KDSmart.

Actions available within Manage Tags include:

◉ ✎ Edit,
◉ ➕Add;
◉ Import From;
◉ Export To;
◉ Delete;
◉ Sort; and
◉ Help.

A Long Press (on a Tag) enters Selection mode with these menu opions:

◉ Select All;
◉ Export To;
◉ Add/Create Tag Bundle; and
◉ Delete (Tag or Remove from Bundle).

Use the ✎ action to Edit or the ➕ action to Add a new Tag and use the Import From and Export To actions to move Tags in and out of KDSmart

Touch a Tag to view details. While viewing Tag Details use the Edit (✎) and Add (➕) actions as required.

Tag Bundles enable the grouping of Tags which can assist with their use and management. The All Tags Bundle is permanent, and cannot be removed.

In the Manage Tags screen, Tag Bundles appear amongst the Tags with the number of Tags in the bundle appearing to the right of the Bundle name. The contents of the Bundles can be expanded ˆ or collapsed ˇ by touching the Bundle Name row.

Add Tags to a Bundle within Manage Tags by a long press of a Tag which will select the Tag and change the menu options. In this mode additional Tags can be selected by a short press of each Tag. With selection complete, select the Add Tag Bundle button to display the Add Tag Bundle window.

To remove a Tag from a Bundle, in Manage Tags locate the Tag within the appropriate Bundle. Long press the Tag name and short press any additional Tags, then select the Remove/Delete button. At the popup menu Select Remove from Bundle and confirm.

A Tag Bundle can be deleted in Manage Tags by a long press of the Bundle name, then select the Delete button and confirm.

Note: Tags can exist in multiple Bundles and removing a Tag from a Bundle will only remove the Tag from the Bundle and does not delete the Tag.

You can touch the Test Validation button to visualise and check how the input dialog for the Trait will work during scoring.

When you Add a Trait a unique Trait Name must be entered. KDSmart assists choosing a unique name by displaying all current Trait Names containing the text entered for the new Trait Name. The Use button will only be made available to touch when your entry does NOT equal an existing name.

Touch the Use button when ready to continue and enter the Description and Validation Type.

Refer to the User Guide for full details about the Validation Type requirements and how they affect the ease with which you can score. (Hint: Avoid using TEXT data type if you can avoid it).

When you Add a Tag you must enter a unique Tag Label.

KDSmart helps choose a unique label by displaying all current Tag Labels containing the text entered for the new Label. The Use button activate when the entry is unique.

Touch the Use button when ready to continue and enter the Description.

When adding a new Tag, start typing the Label (i.e. Tag Name). Tags must be unique so KDSmart will display Tags containing the text entered to assist in choosing a new Label.

The Use button will enable when a unique Tag Label is entered.

When ready, touch the Use button to enter the Description of the new Tag.

When entering a new Trait name KDSmart assists by displaying any existing Trait Names that match the text being entered.
Note: Trait names MUST be unique.

The Use button will enable when a unique Trait Name is entered.

When ready, touch the Use button to enter the other details of the new Trait.
If a Trait Data Type other than TEXT or DATE is chosen constraint values will need to be entered. This is to ensure the Trait values entered are valid.

A custom Alias can be entered to reduce the Trait\'s screen space on the screen when Scoring, useful when a Trait has a lengthy name.

In Path View the footprint buttons move the Trial to the next or previous Visit Group.

Multiple Plot Scoring is possible when 2, 3 or 4 Plots per Group has been selected in the Scoring Configuration panel.
This can assist reducing the distance required to walk in the field.
The buttons for each Plot in the Visit Group appear next to the footprint buttons.
The blue labeled button signifies the current plot (also indicated by the Plot Id).
Touch any of the buttons to make that Plot the current plot.

FieldView, available using the Action Bar, facilitates quick navigation to a plot is by touching the desired cell.

Trait Instances being scored for the Plot are listed beside the Plot buttons and below these appear are the details for any Specimens (sub-Plot items) identified for individual Trait scoring.

In Left Hand Mode the footprint buttons, Plot buttons and the Trait scoring area exchange sides. Switch between Left- and Right-hand modes by using the ⇄ item in the Action Bar.

Touch the Trait Name to view it\'s description and also to jump to the next unscored value for that Trait. Touch the icon for the Plot or Specimen for other options.

Tags, Audio or Photo Attachments can be added using the other buttons on a Plot or Specimen scoring strip as well as review any existing Attachments.

If Lock Scored Traits is activate KDSmart will help prevent inadvertent change of Trait values by reminding that the Trait already has a value, however the value can be altered if is the intention.

Portrait mode on a large screen presents FieldView at the top of screen to facilitate holding the tablet securely towards the lower portion with the various buttons within reach of thumbs.

The Action Bar button ► within a circle activates Auto Advance mode. In this mode KDSmart prompts for the next un-scored Trait immediately following entry of a Trait value.

Auto-advance mode allows the user to focus on only collecting values for unscored Traits.
As in the normal scoring screen, the layout of the Auto-Advance scoring screen changes depending on whether you are:
◉ Using a Tablet- or Phone-sized device;
◉ Using Portrait or Landscape mode; or
◉ In right-handed or left-handed input mode.
The details of Auto Advance are difficult to describe succinctly and a more rigorous coverage is available in the KDSmart User Guide
.

Use GPS on the Scoring menu lets you record a Location whenever a Sample Measurement is scored.
There are two levels of accuracy supported:
◉ GPS: uses GPS satellites and provides a location - usually 7 metres (20 feet) or better.
◉ Network: uses the WiFi or Mobile network and provides an accuracy that may be within 70 metres (or 200 feet).

The accuracy of the Location for GPS depends on the number of satellites the device is able to detect. This option may also use more power than the Network option.

If you are outside in the field, you should use the GPS option. But if you are inside a building, use the Network option as GPS may take some time to find the satellites.

Regardless of your choice, the value chosen in Device Location Services controls the actual accuracy achievable and the power consumption. Confirm your device settings for your desired accuracy and power consumption.

In Auto-Advance scoring you must exit using the Home action (top left corner).

You may skip over the current Trait using the left-most button and move to the next un-scored Trait. You may also use the Back button to return to a previously visited Trait in this auto-advance session.

When you move to another Trait in a Specimen (sub-Plot item) or Plot, a view transition may be used to emphasise that you are looking at a different Trait. You may which Transition to use via the Show Change menu or via the Settings page.

You will be notified if skipping means that then next Plot is not adjacent to the previous Plot.

Warning: If data being imported is for your real, live Trials/Experiments, please ensure KDSmart is NOT in Demonstration Mode. Demonstration Mode is only for Training and Demonstration and subsequent data loss can occur in that mode.

After selecting a file to import each column in the CSV must be assigned an attribute type. This determines how the data in the column will be interpreted. You may choose to NOT import a column as well as choosing whether the data is related to the Trial, a Plot or a Trait Name that you will be scoring. If the file contains values for Traits these will be loaded into KDSmart.

KDSmart will make in informed guess about each column but you may override this by using the drop-down list next to each CSV Heading to direct how the data in the column is interpreted. Values from the first "data" row are displayed to assist you in this.

If unable to guess otherwise, KDSmart will assume that the CSV column represents a Trait Name. If you wish to record the same Trait on successive visits to the Trial site, you may use the Trait Instance functionality in KDSmart to do this; (this is not the same as the date/time scored value that KDSmart records with every measurement that you take).

Trait Instances provide this "temporal" separation so you don\'t need to define separate Traits for each scoring activity. KDSmart provides three alternatives to choose from on how to interpret the tail portion of a Trait Name:

◉ no Trait instances (no special interpretation)
◉ a colon (:) followed by the instance number
◉ two underscores followed by the instance number

Traits are defined to have a Trait Level. This tells KDSmart whether the Trait is for recording measurements for a Plot or for a Specimen within the Plot (also known as "sub-Plot" data).

If the Trait has not been previously defined, you may choose to create the Trait as a Trait for Specimen. If, however, the Trait is already defined, KDSmart will automatically use the current definition.

The names marked with one or two asterisks (*) must be provided before you can import. You MUST provide at least one of:
◉ Plot Id
OR
◉ Plot Row and Plot Column

If you only provide Plot Id you should later edit the Trial Layout to set the Origin Plot Id (this should be less than or equal to the lowest valued Plot Id) and Run Length. This allows KDSmart to display the Trial\'s physical layout in the Field View.

Sample Measurement data in CSV files will be imported and assigned a date/time scored of the time of the CSV import.

Please read Appendix B of the KDSmart User Guide for more details.

The Field View provides an overview of the Trial being scored as a rectangular grid of Cells and enables quick navigation to other Cells (a generic term for Plots, Ponds or other names for the unit within a Trial).

Several zoom levels cater for very brief to more verbose information about the cells. The initial view displays a brief summary about the status of each Cell with various details such as:
◉ the percentage of Traits that have been scored
◉ if Attachments are present
◉ the number of Specimens in the Plot
◉ if there are any Tags

For brevity at some zoom levels, single character codes are used to display this information:
- ⑸ means there are 5 Attachments
- ③ means there are 3 Specimens
- ➋ means there are 2 Tags

The arrow symbols ↑ ↓ ← → indicate the direction of the Collection Path for that cell.

The percentage of scored Traits is also indicated by the shaded portion of the first line of the Cell view. The values of Plot Attributes and Traits may also be listed at different zoom levels.

Cells with a yellow background means they have been selected using the ++ button that appears in the dialog when you touch a Cell or that the cell was found using the Search button.

Use the Search button to find Cells that match a given criteria. KDSmart will let you choose a criteria and a number of associated values; e.g. choose a Plot Attribute and one of its values to select all cells where the Plot Attribute has the chosen values.

Connection with KDXplore via the KDXchange server is done in two stages. First, the available KDXchange servers on your network need to be discovered after which you may choose to activate a connection to a selected KDXchange server.

Previously discovered KDXchange servers are displayed in the list. If none were previously discovered, KDSmart will automatically start searching unless you are using Android 4.0 where this function is not available.

You can manually add a KDXChange server\'s address and port number using the ➕ action menu item. To remove one or more servers, use a long-press on a server name to enter select mode then choose the Delete item.

When KDXchange servers are available, select one and use the play ( ► ) button to activate the connection.

You then use KDXchange to manage the KDSmart device.

Use the Export To button to select a folder location to receive the output. The filename is automatically constructed from the Trial Name.

The first two Export Options omit Sample Measurements which are the Trait Instance scores and include the date/time at which the value was recorded. The options are:
◉ Plots Only to omit measurements for Specimens
◉ Plots & Specimens to include measurements for Specimens
◉ Full ZIP to output all measurements as well as any Attachments.

Check the Include Source Database Id option if you imported database identifiers for the Trial and wish to have these included in the export.

The date/time of each sample measurement is displayed in ISO-8601 format with a trailing time-zone indicator of either Z or the number of hours offset from UTC.

Note: Although the ISO-8601 date format includes the timezone, Microsoft Excel does not automatically interpret the values. Macros and Formulae for converting to Excel dates are available from
http://software.kddart.com/KDXplore/excel-support.html and a formula for conversion is: 

=DATEVALUE(LEFT(A1,10))

+ TIMEVALUE(MID(A1,12,8))

+ IF("Z"=MID(A1,20,LEN(A1)-19),

     0,

     (INT(MID(A1,20,LEN(A1)-19)/100)*60

      + MOD(MID(A1,20,LEN(A1)-19),100))/1440)

where the ISO-8601 date/time string is in cell A1.

The Trial Layout shown represents an X and Y layout. Each X,Y coordinate must be a unique pair in the trial.
 The Trial Layout selection is needed to indicate the Origin.
 Select the new origin then Save, or Cancel to maintain existing setting.

The Trial Layout shown represents a Trial using PlotIDs which must be unique in the trial.
 The Origin & Direction selection indicates where to start and the direction of the Trial Layout (Note: This is Not the direction of walking or traversing the field).
 Traversal indicates the layout pattern, \‘serpentine’ or \‘one way\’.
 Run Length indicates the number of plots occurring before changing traversal.
 Origin PlotID indicates the starting PlotID (e.g. this must be greater or equal to one (1).

The Trial Layout shown represents a Trial using Blocks which must contain a unique X,Y in a block.
 The Origin & Direction selection indicates where to start and the direction of the Block Layout (Note: This is Not the direction of walking or traversing the field).
 Traversal indicates the Block layout pattern, \‘serpentine\’ or \‘one way\'.
 Run Length indicates the number of Blocks occurring before changing traversal.
 Origin BlockID indicates the starting BlockID (e.g. this must be greater or equal to one (1).
 Plot Origin In Block indicates the origin of plots in all Blocks.

Use the Search action to select which features and values will identify the Plots you wish to view then touch the HeatMap button at the bottom right of the feature/value selection panel.

You can select a different opacity or gradient either before or after displaying the HeatMap.

Note that Sample values of -not-scored-, missing or NA are not used for the HeatMap.
Trait level undecidable, cannot change level
Trait was scored, cannot change level
choose \'Import As\' for each CSV column. Use the Help menu if required
Drag Traits to the desired order
Not valid for use in CALC
Select a Trait to see values
Select an Attribute to see values
Cancel when you wish to stop searching
That server is not on your current wireless network.

Your device and the KDXchange server need to be on the same WiFi network. If they are not then it is unlikely that KDSmart can connect.
If "Connect Anyway" does not work, use the "Search" button to try to automatically discover a KDXchange server. If that also fails then you will have to manually provide the address of the KDXchange server using the "plus" button in the menu.
No sample for instance {0,number,integer} of Trait \'{1}\'

Use back button to return to previous Sample
or the Up icon in top-left to exit

If only 1 KDXchange Server address allStrings the WiFi network just connect

Switch Location and Network on to use this Service

After setting use long-touch to re-edit

Edit the Trial and provide a Planting Date first

KDSmart will not work without Storage permission
<\br>
<\br> Application needs Storage permission to store Sample data and Import,Export Trials,Traits and Tags
<\br> To allow storage permissions please select \u2713 and then select ALLOW on the popup dialog.
<\br> To Exit select \u2718
<\br>
<\br> Warning: If you selected Never ask again, please go to
<\br> Settings -> Apps -> KDSmart -> Permissions and allow Storage permission.
<\br>

Need Camera permissions to take Picture
<\br>
<\br> Warning: If you selected Never ask again, please go to
<\br> Settings -> Apps -> KDSmart -> Permissions and allow Storage permission.
<\br>

Need Location permissions to Geo Tag Sample data
<\br>
<\br> Warning: If you selected Never ask again, please go to
<\br> Settings -> Apps -> KDSmart -> Permissions and allow Storage permission.
<\br>

Need Microphone permissions to Record Audio
<\br>
<\br> Warning: If you selected Never ask again, please go to
<\br> Settings -> Apps -> KDSmart -> Permissions and allow Storage permission.
<\br>
Long press a cell to show Heatmap Colour Values

The Scanner tab shows the scanners available.

Functionality not yet available.

The Scales tab shows the scales available.

Functionality not yet available.

The Bluetooth tab shows the Bluetooth devices that have been paired to this device and are currently available.

Select a Bluetooth device to be the default.

In the Database tab, select the:

◉ Folder Location to save the file(s); and
◉ Output format for the export of your Trials. Formats are:
  ◎ Zip - A zip file for each Trial is created, each containing multiple files for the Trial;
  ◎ KDX - Format for KDXplore; or
  ◎ Database - Copies the KDSmart database.

These files may be used to transfer Trial data to another tablet or KDXplore or just can be held as a backup copy.
Unable to find X,Y for plot
Offer N days for DATE data type
Checking trials for errors,\n This will take a few minutes,\n Please don't exit the application
This might take a few minutes
Specimen Tags must have # followed by number or *
Specimen Count Column is required for #*
Plot Traits with #* or # followed by a number not allowed
Plot Tags with #* or # followed by a number not allowed
